newsitem.title: POLAND: Poland says KGHM copper firm sale on track.
newsitem.headline: Poland says KGHM copper firm sale on track.

text.p: The Polish treasury ministry said on Monday preparations for the privatisation of copper combine KGHM Polska Miedz SA are on schedule and its partial sell-off would take place in June, 1997.
"The date of the sale has not changed, it is still June," Kaczmarek told a news briefing.
"The KGHM sale is our number one project, which will decide about our Poland's credibility...and also meeting budget's revenue targets next year," he said.@
He added the sale of KGHM, Europe's largest copper producer, could generate half of revenues from privatisation next year, set at more nearly 3.5 billion zlotys.

KGHM had a net profit of 481.9 million zlotys last year against 351.1 million in 1994 on sales of 3.72 billion zlotys against 2.69 billion in 1994. In 1995 it produced 405,739 tonnes of electrolytic copper and 964 tonnes of silver.
It is estimated to be worth between $2 and $3 billion.
